metadata.title: Enforcement Process — NOVs, Administrative Hearings, Stop-Work Orders, Penalties, and Emergency Orders
metadata.source: SF Building Inspection Commission Code (SFBICC), Sections 102A, 103A, 104A.2.4-5, 107A.5
notes: The enforcement pipeline runs: Inspection → NOV → Administrative Hearing → Administrative Order → Appeals/City Attorney
Emergency orders bypass the hearing process for serious and imminent hazards
Stop-work orders can halt all work on a project with repeated violations
Work-without-permit investigation fees can be appealed but never reduced below 2x the permit fee
Civil penalties: $200-$1,000 per day per violation per unit

triggers: Building Official determines inspection is necessary or desirable
Any person or agency submits a complaint establishing reasonable cause that the building is unsafe

unauthorized_dwelling_units.description: For unauthorized dwelling units constructed without permits, the NOV shall order the owner to file for legalization under Section 106A.3.1.3 and Planning Code Section 207.3.
exceptions: Removal approved by Planning Commission per Planning Code Section 317
Department has determined the unit cannot be legalized under 106A.3.1.3
Building Official has determined a serious and imminent hazard exists
unauthorized_dwelling_units.nov_suspension: NOV is suspended pending a legalization or removal decision. If approved within one year, the NOV and any recorded liens are rescinded.
unauthorized_dwelling_units.extension: Building Official may extend the one-year period if delay is not the owner's fault.

notice_of_violation.title: Notice of Municipal Code Violation (NOV)
notice_of_violation.timing: Within 15 days of observing or determining an unsafe condition
notice_of_violation.prohibition: Building Official shall NOT issue successive NOVs for the same violation as a means of extending filing time or enforcement process.
contents: Penalties, fees, and costs per Sections 102A.7(d) and 103A
service: Mailed by first class mail to owner at Assessor-Recorder's address
Copy made available to each tenant
notice_of_violation.public_record: The NOV is a public record subject to disclosure under Administrative Code Chapter 67.

administrative_hearing.title: Notice of Administrative Hearing
administrative_hearing.trigger: Building Official determines violations not corrected by NOV deadline
administrative_hearing.scheduling: Within 60 days of the deadline, unless owner demonstrates substantial progress
hearing_notice_contents: Date, hour, and place of hearing
Conspicuous warning of penalties, fees, and costs
Notice that interested parties may appear to show cause
administrative_hearing.service_method: Certified mail to owner + certified mail to person in charge, mortgage holders, lien holders, lease holders, and other interest holders
administrative_hearing.continuance: One continuance may be granted for good cause, not to exceed 30 days
administrative_hearing.hearing_officer: The Building Official conducts or designates a Hearing Officer. The Hearing Officer must NOT be the same individual who signed the NOV.

administrative_order.title: Administrative Order
administrative_order.timing: Within 30 days following the conclusion of the hearing
contents: Conditions rendering the building unsafe (in reasonable detail)
administrative_order.extension: One extension for good cause, limited to minimum time necessary, not to exceed 90 days

costs.department_costs: All preparation, hearing, and administrative costs assessed monthly at Table 1A-D and 1A-K rates
costs.attorneys_fees: Department entitled to attorney fees and expert witness fees
costs.lien_enforcement: Failure to pay results in tax lien proceedings against the property

administrative_order.recording: Administrative Order recorded in the Assessor-Recorder's Office. Rescission recorded when work is completed.
administrative_order.appeal: To the Abatement Appeals Board per Section 105A.2, filed within 15 days after the Order is posted and served.

civil_penalties.description: Each real property address, each unit within a multi-unit property, and each separate violation is a distinct violation for calculation.
factors_considered: Nature and seriousness of the misconduct
Length of time over which misconduct occurred
Defendant's assets, liabilities, and net worth

criminal_penalties.separate_offense: Each day of continuing violation is a separate offense

unlawful_demolition_penalty.applies_to: Any agent, contractor, or other person causing demolition without a permit

standard_stop.trigger: Any work being done contrary to code provisions or pertinent laws
standard_stop.method: Written notice served on persons engaged in or causing the work
standard_stop.effect: All work must stop immediately until authorized by the Building Official to proceed

full_project_stop.trigger: Project has a history of repeated violations
full_project_stop.effect: ALL work on the project stopped until all code violations are fully investigated and resolved
full_project_stop.requestors: Director of DBI, Director of Public Works, or Director of Planning may request the stop

occupancy_violations.description: When a building is being used contrary to code provisions, the Building Official may order the use discontinued and the building vacated. The person must discontinue the use within the time prescribed.

investigation_fees_work_without_permit.description: When work requiring a permit has been started without one, a special investigation is required before a permit may be issued.
investigation_fees_work_without_permit.fee_table: Table 1A-K — Penalties, Hearings, Code Enforcement Assessments
investigation_fees_work_without_permit.partial_work: If only a portion of work was done without a permit, the fee is based on the portion done without a permit.

appeal_options.initial: Owner/agent may appeal fee amount for just cause (unfamiliarity with code, employee negligence)
appeal_options.building_official_reduction: May reduce to 2x the permit fee (Table 1A-A) for work predating current ownership, with documentation
appeal_options.board_of_appeals: If Building Official rules against applicant, appeal to Board of Appeals. Board may reduce but never below 2x the permit fee.

city_performs_work.title: Failure to Comply with Order
city_performs_work.trigger: Order not complied with within the time set by the Building Official or the Abatement Appeals Board
city_powers: Vacate, barricade, or secure the building against use/occupancy
Dismantle or demolish the building and clear the site
Repair or alter the building to render it safe and compliant

forfeiture_of_right.process: Building Official provides 10 days notice of intent to do work. After that date, the owner forfeits all right to do the work.
forfeiture_of_right.cost_assessment: All costs assessed against the property per Section 102A.17

emergency_orders.title: Serious and Imminent Hazards — Emergency Orders
emergency_orders.trigger: Condition constituting an imminent and substantial hazard to life, health, safety, or to the building itself, requiring prompt action
may_order: Vacate and keep vacant until written permission to reoccupy
Barricade, board up, or secure against entry/occupancy/use
Demolish or repair/alter/correct serious and imminent hazard conditions
emergency_orders.city_may_compel_work: If owner fails to comply within 48 hours of posting and service, the Building Official may cause the work to be done.
emergency_orders.repair_cost_limit: Repairs/alterations ordered by the Building Official shall not exceed 50% of the assessed value of the building.
emergency_orders.service: Posted conspicuously on property, served on owner per Section 102A.4, recorded in Assessor-Recorder's Office.

fire_life_safety_notice.title: Continuing or Recurring Conditions Creating a Fire Hazard
fire_life_safety_notice.applies_to: Residential buildings with 3 or more dwelling units
fire_life_safety_notice.trigger: Two or more NOVs and Administrative Orders for fire safety violations that continue or recur
may_order: Improve existing fire sprinkler system to current code
Improve existing fire alarm/detection to current code
fire_life_safety_notice.appeal: To the Abatement Appeals Board per Section 105A.2, scheduled within 14 days of filing

expanded_compliance_control.title: Expanded Compliance Control and Permit Review
expanded_compliance_control.trigger: Three or more reported violations within 18 months, or egregious single violations
tracking_violations: Misrepresentation of existing conditions or project scope
Structural work or demolition without or beyond scope of permit
Criminal conviction involving fraud, willful misrepresentation, or bribery
expanded_compliance_control.extension: Subsequent violations extend the period by 5 years from date of new violation
measures: Referral to licensing boards and regulatory agencies
All applications undergo senior staff and multi-station review
Site inspections by DBI and Planning before permit issuance
Licensed contractor must be named on permit before issuance
Consultation with City Attorney for additional enforcement
